content.description:
A student reacts <math alttext="M g solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="H C l aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the value of <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction represented by the following equation.

<math alttext="M g solid plus 2 H C l aqueous react to produce M g C l 2 aqueous plus H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>Mg(</mtext> <mi>s</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>HCl(</mtext> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>MgCl</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>g</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

Information for the experiment is given in the following table.

Mass of <math alttext="M g solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> used
 <math alttext="2.4 grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Volume of <math alttext="1.0 molar H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> used
 <math alttext="300 decimal point milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Temperature change of solution
 <math alttext="15.1 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Specific heat of solution
 <math alttext="4.0 joules per gram kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>4.0</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>J/(g</mtext> <mo>⋅</mo> <mtext>K)</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
content.question: If the student conducts a second trial and uses the same mass of <math alttext="M g solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> but <math alttext="500 decimal point milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="1.0 molar H C l" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1.0</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>M</mi> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>HCl</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, which of the following will occur?

choices.label: The value of the calculated <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase.

The temperature change of the solution will be less than <math alttext="15.1 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The temperature change of the solution will be approximately <math alttext="25 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The temperature change of the solution will be <math alttext="15.1 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The temperature change of the solution will be less than <math alttext="15.1 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
